tv.generator-info-name: Processed by Open-EPG Visual Processor v1.0

programme.title: Rage
programme.desc: Discover the wildest new music videos on rage. Essential grooves and boundary-pushing visuals from Australia and beyond.

programme.title: Weekend Breakfast
programme.desc: Ease into your Sunday as Fauziah Ibrahim and Johanna Nicholson present a mix of the latest news, updated information, analysis, interviews, politics, global affairs, culture and weather. Plus sport with Daniela Intili.

programme.title: Offsiders
programme.desc: Abbey Gelmi and the panel Clare Lindop, Bharat Sundaresan and Quentin Hull discuss Australian cricket team selection ahead of the Ashes, the Kangaroos and Wallabies against England, plus Derby Day and Tuesdays Melbourne Cup.

programme.title: Compass: The Conclave
programme.desc: As cardinals gather in Rome to elect the next Pope, Compass is there. The conclave is a secret ballot held by Catholic cardinals. Geraldine Doogue and Noel Debien follow the excitement and intrigue of this historic event.

programme.title: Gardening Australia
programme.sub-title: Spring: Backyard Habitat and Pruning Natives
programme.desc: Jane discovers a lush urban courtyard, Josh joins a research team tracking backyard biodiversity, Hannah explores a flourishing cottage garden, Millie tackles native maintenance, and we meet award-winning poultry breeders.

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Two family mysteries; a man left in a pram as a baby, is searching for his birth mother to discover the truth about his beginnings, and a daughter looking for the Italian birth father she has never met.

programme.title: Grand Designs Australia
programme.desc: At Rye on the Mornington Peninsula, Ryan plans to build a unique home, with boulders in the living room, and his bedroom in a cave.

programme.title: My Brother Jack
programme.desc: David, now a successful writer for the Morning Post, covers the 1937 Anzac Day celebrations, where his mother and father march with their old units.

programme.title: The Art Of Ageing
programme.desc: Guest host Yumi Stynes ponders Is there an art to ageing? Seeking inspiration, Yumi visits artist Lindy Lee, dancer Meryl Tankard and author Kathy Lette. Meanwhile Namila Benson visits artist Maree Clarke at her workshop.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across the day. Presented by Gemma Veness.

programme.title: Annika
programme.desc: A Scottish millionaire found dead in a shark tank becomes Annika and the teams most high-profile investigation yet.

programme.title: Parliament Question Time
programme.desc: A new sitting week in Federal Parliament begins with coverage of Question Time from the Senate.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team visit Hatfield House in Hertfordshire. Amongst the objects exciting the experts are a collection of almost 500 ornamental pigs and dolls house furniture made out of shell cases from the Somme in WWI.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus analysis from 7.30s Political Editor Jacob Greber.

programme.title: Four Corners
programme.desc: As Australia signs a landmark deal to bolster its alliance with Washington, were selling China the critical minerals it needs to build hypersonic missiles and nuclear technology. (Final for 2025)

programme.title: Planet America
programme.desc: Chas and John discuss the week in America including fallout from Trumps meeting with Chinas President Xi, the federal government shutdown, Venezuela, Ukraine, the White House ballroom, tariffs, immigration and security.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Follow the story with the latest on the days events, explaining whats happening and why it matters. ABC News has reporters across Australia and around the globe uncovering what you need to know. Presented by Michael Tetlow.

programme.title: Creative Types With Virginia Trioli
programme.desc: Award winning filmmaker, Kaytetye man, Warwick Thornton has three people warring inside him: director, writer, cinematographer: but one must always win. In the searing beauty of Alice Springs, we witness the struggles.

programme.title: Good Game Spawn Point
programme.sub-title: Hello Neighbour 2 Beta And Darrens Birthday
programme.desc: We head back into the world of creepy neighbours as we break into their houses and hide from them in Hello Neighbour 2s Beta, plus DARREN shares some big news on his birthday!

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.sub-title: Knobbly Knees And What They Are For
programme.desc: Can you wobble your kneecaps?! Find out why and what you need them for in todays lab. Meet three amazing Big Heart Ouch Award nominees and find out who is Top Doc in Ouchology.

programme.title: Horrible Histories Special: Staggering Storytellers
programme.desc: Spanning 3,000 years of recorded history we look at how some of our finest writers cured their writing block. We see the development of storytelling technology and learn how Charles Dickens was the Harry Styles of his day.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: The Farmer has set up a stall by the side of the road, selling produce from the garden. He leaves Bitzer in charge for the day. But lazy Bitzer soon gets bored and gives Shaun the job while he puts his feet up by the pool.

programme.title: Crongton
programme.desc: McKay plans a family meal. The gang hunts for the key ingredient in North Crongton.

programme.title: Abbott Elementary
programme.desc: The teachers are appalled after seeing a commercial criticizing Abbott Elementary.

programme.title: Secrets Of The Zoo
programme.desc: This week at the Columbus Zoo: daredevil flying goats, adorable cheetah cubs, a cranky female tiger, a lethal king cobra and a rhino that paints!

programme.title: BTN High
programme.desc: Cale visits a simulated space mission to the moon thats putting so-called analogue astronauts to the test.

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: Fred Sirieix guides Rattus through the Horrible History of Manners, including the benefits of not holding farts in, Puritan dating, and Jane Austen visits Historical Love Island.

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Extremely Empty Freezer
programme.desc: DI Bones investigates an unusual Victorian traffic accident; Prime Ministers Neville Chamberlain and Winston Churchill argue over what to do about Adolf Hitler; and we discover the horrible history of early Australia.

programme.title: Odd Squad
programme.desc: Olive and Otto are sent to Shapely Manor to investigate an odd crime with even odder people.

programme.title: ABC Kids Programs Resume At 4am
programme.desc: ABC Kids programs resume at 4.00am

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: The Farmer is throwing a fancy-dress house party for his birthday. Bitzer is entrusted with posting the invites but fools around on the way to the post box and loses them all!

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Gladiator Dynamite puts Dr Dan and Dr Raphs core muscles to the test, Dr Chris shoots hoops with a basketball dunking champ, while Dr Ronx is lifted into the air by finger power!

programme.title: Gladiators UK
programme.desc: Dynamite ignites in Duel, Diamonds well and truly sent over The Edge, and there is mayhem in the Gauntlet as four angry Gladiators go rogue.

programme.title: rage Wu-Tang Clan Special
programme.desc: After the announcement of their final Australian tour last week, rage Brings Da Ruckus with non-stop Wu-Tang Clan clips.

programme.title: Jonestown: Terror In The Jungle
programme.desc: The press exposes the dark side of Jim Jones, causing a mass exodus to Jonestown. His followers soon realise its not the utopia their leader promised.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The doctors make an unusual type of cheese with Dr Xands body bacteria, find out what to do if someone breaks their leg in First Aid, and Dr Chris meets a man with a bionic eye.

programme.title: 100% Wolf: Legend Of The Moonstone
programme.desc: Freddy becomes convinced that theres a wilderwolf at Howlington and launches a daring investigation to prove that its the school accountant, Mr Sminch. Howlington gets a new teacher, the super cool and charming Ric Rawls.

programme.title: The Strange Chores
programme.desc: Creating some Clones to help with his long list of commitments, Pierce must confront his weakness for people-pleasing, and learn how to set some boundaries.

programme.title: Mythbusters
programme.desc: Could you build a jet-pack from plans on the internet? And, the build team suffers for science in the myth of pyramid power.

programme.title: Louis Therouxs Forbidden America
programme.desc: Louis Theroux heads to Los Angeles as the world of adult entertainment grapples with its own wave of #MeToo. (Final)

programme.title: ER
programme.desc: The moon is full and so is the ER. Hathaways patient believes that he is a werewolf. Dr. Greene is still haunted by the death of Jodi OBrien and isnt sure he can function as a doctor. Benton tends to his sick mother.

programme.title: Rage New Music
programme.desc: Discover the wildest new music videos on rage. Essential grooves and boundary-pushing visuals from Australia and beyond.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig looks at some quirky questions with Alan Davies, Loyiso Gola, Jason Manford and Sarah Millican.

programme.title: Adam Hills: The Last Leg
programme.desc: Adam Hills, Josh Widdicombe and Alex Brooker take a look at the weeks events including England against France in a World Cup Quarter Final, after Argentina end Australias run. With guests Jimmy Carr and Judi Love.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The doctors set fire to food (all in the name of science!) Dr Xand goes to an asthma clinic, and in Ouch and About the Ouch-Mobile opens its doors to solve more intriguing medical mysteries.

programme.title: 100% Wolf: Legend Of The Moonstone
programme.desc: The kids are struck down by a flea infestation, and Freddy and Batty are tasked with tracking down the mysterious Doog, keeper of the Fleaminator, the most powerful flea treatment known to dog, before theyre all expelled!

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Owen has his superball confiscated and locked up in Chefs office. Duncan, seeing an opportunity to get help escaping the daycare, leads an away team into the vents to recover Owens ball.

programme.title: Transformers: Earthspark
programme.desc: Jawbreaker and Aftermath accidentally get stuck together! Can they handle being stuck together and what lurks in the wilderness?

programme.title: Pokemon: Ruby And Sapphire
programme.sub-title: Get the Show on the Road!
programme.desc: Pikachu is suffering from a serious electrical overload! Can Ash and Professor Birch find a solution before its too late?

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Hannah and Zsofi plant a colourful edible flower garden, perfect for a yummy garden tea party.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The Doctors turn into superheroes to reveal why your ribcage is the perfect design. In the Emergency Department one patient has a rock in their ear, another has swallowed a coin!

programme.title: Know It Alls: Science
programme.desc: Comedian Gen Fricker and young Nayara splash their way through the interconnected oceans on a fact-finding mission through the Australian National Maritime Museum.

programme.title: Mythbusters
programme.sub-title: Killer Brace Positions? / Cell Phone Vs. Drunk Driving
programme.desc: Is the brace position intended to save you or kill you? And, is driving and chatting on the phone just as dangerous as driving under the influence?

programme.title: Penn And Teller: Fool Us
programme.sub-title: I Now Pronounce You Magic and Wife
programme.desc: Featured magicians include Paco Agrado, The Cosmic Romantics, Kingsley Xu and Damien Dubi.

programme.title: In The Night Garden
programme.desc: Makka Pakka is washing the ball when his Uff-uff blows right away. It falls into Upsy Daisys bed.

programme.title: Hoopla Doopla!
programme.desc: Ziggy wishes he was just like his favourite super-hero. So he makes himself a costume and goes to find someone to rescue in town.

programme.title: Daniel Tigers Neighbourhood
programme.desc: During a beach party at school, Prince Wednesday spills paint on his pants and the floor! Hes really upset, but telling Teacher Harriet what happened makes him feel so much better.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing and Flop are building a sandcastle when Pando joins them in the sandpit with his wind-up digger toy to help. Bing finds a lovely thing in the sand and thinks it will make the perfect decoration for the top of his castle.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and Suzy are best friends. But one day they quarrel so theyre not best friends anymore. They really miss each other but refuse to make up. When they finally do, they realise that they will always be best friends.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Calm in the barn is disturbed when a pair of ducks set up a nest on the roof of Bitzers kennel. The ducks dont take kindly to efforts to encourage them to move on.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Banana Superstars show is stopped when Evil Pea steals his peel. Supertato races against him to get it back, but trouble hits when a giant banana statue collapses onto the stage.

programme.title: Isadora Moon
programme.desc: When Ava, an unfriendly girl, arrives in Isadoras class, she hurts Isadoras feelings by suggesting shes not a real half fairy!

programme.title: Super Monsters
programme.sub-title: Glorb the Gobbler / Hullabaloo at the Petting Zoo
programme.desc: The Super Monsters meet magical animals at the petting zoo, help Griffy the griffin learn to fly, and work together to fix Glorbs giant mishap after overfeeding him, learning teamwork in a fun-filled adventure.

programme.title: Super Monsters: Once Upon A Rhyme
programme.desc: The Super Monsters share magical fairy tales and nursery rhymes, bringing stories to life with humor, songs, and lessons of friendship, inspiring younger Monster kiddos to embrace imagination and teamwork.

programme.title: Maddie + Triggs
programme.desc: Maddie + Triggs are magically transported to a world of echoes inside the belly of a whale, where they try to help their new friend Harriot rediscover her singing voice.

programme.title: Andy And The Band
programme.desc: Odd Sock Mary has a valuable vase shed like protecting. Mary needs to sell the vase to raise funds to keep her art gallery open. Cousin Mac invents a super security alarm, but theres a notorious art thief on the prowl!

programme.title: Play School Science Time
programme.desc: Why do things change shape when we look at them through water? Teo investigates light refraction and experiments with patterns and drawings to see how they change when seen through water!

programme.title: Builder Brothers Dream Factory
programme.desc: Its an epic game of "Find the Flag" - and the winner gets to open the mystery box of presents that Drew and Jonathans mom brought back from her business trip.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.sub-title: The Octonauts And The Sardine School
programme.desc: The Octonauts must work together as a team to help a lost sardine find her school.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The squirrels learn about how to achieve their ambitions.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: Big World! Big Adventures!
programme.desc: When Diesel hides from the other engines, his plans backfire and its him that gets a surprise.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Hannah works with two brothers to create a garden that delights all of the senses. Alfie is vision impaired and loves being active and playing, so they create a garden of games he can enjoy with his brother, William.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and Suzy have nothing to do, and are bored. Daddy Pig finds them an old box of garden games to play with. But not all the games are easy for little George.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Mum and Dad are going on an adventure wearing the kids as their cheeky backpacks! Seeing the sights and buying street food, backpacking is a blast - until they lose their passports.

programme.title: Steve and Aneeshwar Go Wild
programme.desc: Steve and Aneeshwar meet two giraffes, the tallest animals in the world, to feed them leaves. Then they meet some red pandas to see their wild connection with giraffes.

programme.title: In The Night Garden
programme.desc: The Pontipines decide to have their dinner on the Ninky Nonk.

programme.title: Hoopla Doopla!
programme.desc: The Hoopla cafe door is stuck, Mimi is inside and everybody else is outside. All her friends try to help fix the door and rescue Mimi in time for morning tea.

programme.title: Daniel Tigers Neighbourhood
programme.sub-title: Daniel And Miss Elainas Kite Accident
programme.desc: Daniel is playing at Miss Elainas house when they accidentally break her dads old kite. They feel bad, but when they tell Music Man Stan what happened, he explains that accidents happen to everyone, even adults!

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Its a beautiful Autumn day and Bing and Sula are in the park with Flop collecting acorns. When Bings pile of acorns keeps getting smaller Flop suggests they hide behind a bush to see whats happening to them.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Mummy Pig orders a new toy cupboard. It arrives in the post and has to be assembled. Mummy and Daddy Pig are not very good at DIY. Luckily help is to hand; Mr Zebra the Postman loves assembling flat pack furniture.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Shaun discovers that being in charge while Bitzer is busy with the Farmer, is not just a case of being the bossy dog.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: The bream has gone missing from the fish counter at the Wholefish Cafe, and Detective James is determined to crack The Case of the Missing Fish.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: On a tour of the Elf Factory, the Elf and Fairy children learn about recycling and see how rubbish is re-used and made into toys. When the factory runs out of raw material, they set out to find some more.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and her family have gone on holiday. They are staying in a teeny tiny little holiday home near the beach.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: When Spyke introduces Neville to his alter ego Daredevil Neville, her fun-filled Splash Bash take a dangerous turn.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: Cosima and Big Lizard investigate the cause of Dads mysterious sleepwalking in an adventure that takes them around Proxima and right back home again.

programme.title: Play School: Make and Create
programme.desc: Abi and Takaya are in The Make and Create Studio using natural materials to decorate nature bags! Special guest Tegan weaves a basket for Jemima, and Abi and Takaya create bird costumes from materials found in The Useful Box!

programme.title: Nikhil and Jay
programme.sub-title: Nikhil and Jay and the Messiest Mango
programme.desc: Jay dreams of being crowned the messiest mango eater ever, ever, ever, but Appa doesnt want drips on the clean floor. So Jay eats his mango in the bath!

programme.title: The Sound Collector
programme.desc: When Mole is scared by a dog, the Sound Collector discovers they have something in common.

programme.title: Bananas In Pyjamas
programme.desc: The Bananas discover that helping Topsy learn to ride a bike is harder than they thought.

programme.title: Wiggle And Learn
programme.desc: Celebrate with The Wiggles as they look back on some of their favourite memories! From holidays to parties, to even a great plate of jelly, its the Best of Wiggle and Learn!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and Suzy have nothing to do, and are bored. Daddy Pig finds them an old box of garden games to play with. But not all the games are easy for little George.

programme.title: Builder Brothers Dream Factory
programme.desc: The Dream Factory Crew have to come up with a way to deliver Ms. Kashanis very popular homemade Roti on time and save the school fundraising campaign!

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.sub-title: The Octonauts And The Eel Ordeal
programme.desc: The Octonauts travel up a treacherous river to help a young migrating eel on her difficult journey.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The squirrels gather all the colours and make their very own Rainbow.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: Big World! Big Adventures!
programme.desc: Shane is having too much fun to stop and refuel; that is, until he runs out of coal and is stranded in the hot, red desert.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Costa and the kids build a frog bog from an upcycled sink with hidey holes for the frogs and surround it with plants. We check back to see if the frogs come.

programme.title: Wiggle And Learn
programme.desc: Discover fun ways to travel, from walking, to driving, to even flying a plane! Race with Tsehay and Captain Feathersword, then join in to craft a little sailboat!

programme.title: Ariel
programme.desc: Ariel explores Rainbow Sea Caves.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.sub-title: Mr Bull In A China Shop
programme.desc: While enjoying a tea break, Mr Bull accidentally breaks his delicate teapot. He takes the pieces to Miss Rabbit in the hope that she can mend it.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Gekko is so anxious about facing a bullying villain, that he stays home one night to avoid her.

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: The Browns have new neighbours and Toq is full of tales like theres a goblin in the garden and her dad is an astronaut! They cant be true, can they?

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Lucy celebrates her birthday with an Elf and Fairy party. Lucys Dad does a magic show but things get a bit out of hand when Princess Holly and her friends join in...

programme.title: Rocket Club
programme.desc: Rocket Club visit a diner on Pluto owned by a bi-ped dog who has an underground garden were he grows his ingredients.

programme.title: Rage
programme.desc: Discover the wildest new music videos on rage. Essential grooves and boundary-pushing visuals from Australia and beyond.

programme.title: ABC News Overnight
programme.desc: The final word on the days top stories, with the latest news and updated information from Australias most trusted source of independent news. Presented by Mariam Saab.

programme.title: ABC News Regional
programme.desc: Two people killed in an underground mine explosion, a close encounter with a meteor for a rural driver, plus the lengths a male dolphin will go to attract a mate. Presented by Amy Culpitt.

programme.title: ABC News Overnight
programme.desc: The final word on the days top stories, with the latest news and updated information from Australias most trusted source of independent news. Presented by Mariam Saab.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: Asia News Week
programme.desc: Join Yvonne Yong for the news from Asia: Trump and Xi meet after months of trade tensions between the US and China, ASEAN welcomes Timor-Leste, plus at Halloween we examine why horror fans love Indonesias golden era of gore.

programme.title: Way Out AG
programme.desc: Jujubes have been grown in Asia for thousands of years but are relatively new to Australia. Some inventive farmers in South Australias Riverland are now even turning it into vinegar and beer, as Landline reported in 2020.

programme.title: BTN High
programme.desc: The eSafety commissioner, Julie Inman Grant, answers your questions about the upcoming social media ban.

programme.title: Not Stupid
programme.desc: As Donald Trump and Chinas Xi Jinping meet for the first time since 2019, Jeremy Fernandez and guest host Emma Shortis discuss the meeting and what it means for the future of the relationship between the two superpowers.

programme.title: ABC News Regional
programme.desc: Two people killed in an underground mine explosion, a close encounter with a meteor for a rural driver, plus the lengths a male dolphin will go to attract a mate. Presented by Amy Culpitt.

programme.title: Insiders
programme.desc: David Speers discusses the week in politics with Clare Armstrong, Paul Sakkal and Katina Curtis including environment protection reform, power prices, Tomago, net zero, a jump in inflation, APEC, Sussan Ley and the Coalition.

programme.title: ABC News
programme.desc: Melissa Mackay presents the latest from ABC News on the weekend bringing you todays top stories and coverage of events as they unfold. Plus original reporting, analysis and updated news, sport, weather and information.

programme.desc: Melissa Mackay presents the latest from ABC News on the weekend bringing you todays top stories and coverage of events as they unfold. Plus original reporting, analysis and updated news, sport, weather and information.

programme.title: ABC News Update
programme.desc: The headlines from ABC News, updating you on the days top stories from across Australia and around the world.

programme.title: ABC News With Auslan
programme.desc: The latest news and information from ABC News. This bulletin will be Auslan interpreted to provide accessible information to keep Australias deaf community connected and informed. Presented by Melissa Mackay.

programme.title: ABC Evening News
programme.desc: For the latest news as it happens ABC News is the home of breaking news, compelling stories and Australias best investigative journalism. Round the clock coverage of the news that matters to you from the team you can trust.

programme.title: ABC National News
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time for transparency and trust. ABC News brings you the days top stories and latest news with more reporters to tell you whats going on and why it matters. Presented by Meredith Sheehan.

programme.title: ABC News Tonight
programme.desc: Meredith Sheehan brings you the latest headlines and a brief summary of the days top stories from ABC News.

programme.title: ABC Nightly News
programme.desc: Wherever you are and whenever you need us, ABC News is here to bring you round the clock coverage of the latest news and todays stories. Plus reporters investigating issues that matter to you. Presented by Meredith Sheehan.

programme.title: ABC Late News Weekend
programme.desc: When you need to know whats happening turn to ABC News for coverage you can trust. We bring you todays events from reporters across Australia, connecting communities and telling your stories. Presented by Meredith Sheehan.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Live across Australia, the latest headlines and the days top stories from ABC News. We have reporters on the ground connecting communities, telling your stories and bringing you coverage of whats happening as it unfolds.

programme.title: Close Of Business
programme.desc: A red hot inflation number delivers a knockout blow to hopes of a Melbourne Cup rate cut. Plus Australian defence manufacturing on the frontline as counter drone technology takes off. Presented by Alicia Barry.

programme.title: Landline
programme.desc: Local growers and food processors competing against the rising tide of cheap imports; The high toll of rural crime on farms; and the dairy farmers preserving their family farm by embracing a hi-tech future.

programme.title: Insiders
programme.desc: David Speers discusses the week in politics with Clare Armstrong, Paul Sakkal and Katina Curtis including environment protection reform, power prices, Tomago, net zero, a jump in inflation, APEC, Sussan Ley and the Coalition.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: DW Focus On Europe
programme.desc: How are people in Spain recovering one year after the deadly floods? Plus why are so many French people angry at President Macron?

programme.title: Unusual Farmers
programme.desc: It tastes like nutty, salty, custard and its a seafood delicacy. Developing the market for the roe of the long-spined sea urchin in Tasmania is also helping to deal with an invasive pest.

programme.title: News Breakfast
programme.desc: As each day begins get the facts you need to stay informed. Bridget Brennan and James Glenday present the latest news, overnight developments and todays top stories, joined by Emma Rebellato, Catherine Murphy and Nate Byrne.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon
programme.desc: The leading news at lunchtime. Kathryn Robinson brings you todays top stories and the latest news as it unfolds, with reporters in the community across Australia and around the world reporting on the issues that matter most.

programme.title: Parliament Question Time
programme.desc: Parliament resumes for a new sitting week. Live coverage of Question Time from the House of Representatives.

programme.title: ABC News With Joe OBrien
programme.desc: Joe OBrien brings you a comprehensive summary of the days events, with the latest breaking news, in depth coverage of the top stories, live crosses, interviews and explainers to bring you up to speed on whats going on.

programme.title: ABC National News
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time for transparency and trust. ABC News brings you the days top stories and latest news, with more reporters to tell you whats going on and why it matters. Presented by Joe OBrien.

programme.title: ABC News Tonight
programme.desc: The latest breaking news and a comprehensive roundup of the days best stories from across Australias states and regions. With reporters in more places ABC News tells the stories that matter to you. Presented by Yvonne Yong.

programme.title: The World
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time to stay in touch with whats happening in our world. Girish Sawlani presents the latest international news from ABC News correspondents as well as interviews with experts and guests.

programme.title: Planet America
programme.desc: Chas and John discuss the week in America including fallout from Trumps meeting with Chinas President Xi, the federal government shutdown, Venezuela, Ukraine, the White House ballroom, tariffs, immigration and security.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus analysis from 7.30s Political Editor Jacob Greber.
